episode_title: 614 - The One Where Chandler Can’t Cry

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Rachel is still looking out the window as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, uh, hey Rach. I uh, I was just coming over here to uh… Oh wait, I don’t have to lie to you, you don’t live here anymore. Uh, I’m eating their food. What are you doing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross is on a date with my sister and they shut the drapes two and a-half-hours ago.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, I didn’t know we could date your sister!
(Chandler and Monica enter from their room and Joey quickly hides the bag of potato chips behind his back.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey we know you steal our food.
(Joey offers them some potato chips.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, are the drapes still closed hon?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. And y’know who should’ve shut their drapes? Is that perverted old couple two doors over.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is that a swing?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh don’t even ask!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yuck!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe Ross went out with Rachel’s sister! When Chandler made out with my sister I was mad at him for 10 years.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was like 5 years ago.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah you got 5 years left!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You wanna make it 6?!

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is on the couch reading as Rachel enters. It’s the next day.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Ross, hi! Hey, how are ya? There you are!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll take a coffee. (To Ross) So how was your big date last night?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uhh, it was okay. Yeah, it was fun.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah fun? Great! So uh, so did you guys hit it off?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I guess so.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So uh, so did anything happen? Because rumor has it you guys shut the drapes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No. Nothing happened. I shut the drapes to uh, show her slides of my favorite fossils.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, slides. (Laughs.) So really nothing happened.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Something could’ve happened. All right? She-she really dug my slides. And-and she was definitely giving me the vibe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right. Was it the, “Please don’t show me another picture of a trilobite vibe?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anyway, if she, if she wasn’t in to me, why-why would she ask me out again?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She asked-asked you out again?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah-uh-huh. Tomorrow night, Valentine’s Day, the most romantic day of the year. Who knows what could happen? I might not be shutting my drapes to show her my slides, if you know what I mean.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay-okay-okay-okay-okay-okay-okay! I got it! I got it! I got it! I can’t! I can’t! I can’t! I cannot go with you and my sister thing. Okay? I just can’t. It’s just too weird, all right? I imagine the two of you together and I freak out. It freaks me out. I can’t do it! I can’t do it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! Okay! Okay! It’s okay. (Rachel stops.) It’s okay. Hey, it’s too weird for you, I won’t see her again.
content.parenthetical: while Rachel is finishing her rant

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. I…yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I mean after tomorrow night.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no-no! No-no-no! Please Ross, I can’t! I can’t do it! (Starts to freak out.) It’s just gonna freak me out!!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! Okay! Ooh-hey-hey-hey! Okay! Okay! Okay! I’ll-I’ll tell her tonight I can’t see her anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross thanks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You want me to call her right now?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no! No! No-no-no-no! No, I mean come on that’s-that’s crazy—I mean that’s crazy. So what’s-what’s going on with you? What is going on with you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well umm, oh! I might be teaching another class this semester!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah do it now, call right now.

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, and Joey are watching ET.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is my favorite part.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah me too.
(We see the TV and it’s the last scene where ET is saying goodbye.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh y’know what’s sadder than this? Bambi . I cried for three days with that movie. No wait two! Because on the third day my mother killed herself so I was partly crying for that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well see now that I can see crying over, but Bambi is a cartoon!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You didn’t cry when Bambi’s mother died?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes it was very sad when the guy stopped drawing the deer!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler there’s nothing wrong with crying! I mean you don’t have to be so macho all the time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not macho.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah you’re right. I don’t know what I was thinking.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I guess I just never really cried. Y’know? I’m not a crying kind of guy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on man there’s gotta be something that gets you choked up! Like uh, uh oh, what if you saw a three-legged puppy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’d be sad sure, but I wouldn’t cry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, what if the puppy said, “Help me Chandler. All the other puppies pick on me.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Cry?! I just found a talking puppy, I’m rich!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I’ve got it! I have got it! (Gets up and gets something from the dresser underneath the TV.) Pictures from your childhood. This will get you going good!
(Chandler starts paging through the album.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, what’s going on there? (Points to a picture.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that’s Parent’s Day, first grade. That’s me with the janitor Martin.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where were your parents?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh they didn’t want to come!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh Chandler!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Poor thing!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So that story doesn’t make you cry?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! Look, I don’t cry! It’s not a big deal! Okay?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! It’s not okay! It’s not okay at all!! You’re dead inside!!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is putting away her guitar as a man approaches.

content.speaker: The Fan
content.text: Excuse me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: The Fan
content.text: Are you Phoebe Buffay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: The Fan
content.text: Can-can I get your autograph, I’m your biggest fan. (Holds out a napkin and a pen.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh you’re my biggest fan? I’ve always wanted to meet you! Hi! (Shakes his hand.) Sure! Yeah! (Signs the autograph)

content.speaker: The Fan
content.text: Wow! Wow, thanks a lot! I just wanna say, I think you’re really talented.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re just saying that because you’re my biggest fan. (The fan leaves and Joey approaches.) (To Joey) Joey listen, take good care of that guy, okay? (Points) He’s a fan. (To the fan as she’s leaving) Bye! (Exits)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, you saw me on Days Of Our Lives huh? Want me to, want me to do a little Dr. Drake Remoray for ya?

content.speaker: The Fan
content.text: I have no idea what you’re talking about. But I, but I just got Phoebe Buffay’s autograph!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you’re Phoebe’s fan!

content.speaker: The Fan
content.text: Oh yeah! I’ve seen all her movies.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Movies?

content.speaker: The Fan
content.text: That was Phoebe Buffay, the porn star.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t think so.

content.speaker: The Fan
content.text: No-no, it was! She was in Sex Toy Story 2, Lawrence of Alabia, and I got her autograph! The guys at the comic book store aren’t gonna believe this! (Exits.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Gunther, don’t let that guy in here anymore! He just said Phoebe’s a porn star!

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Well, I wouldn’t call her a star, but she’s really good. You should check out Inspecther Gadget.

content.description: Central Perk, time lapse, Rachel is at the counter as Jill enters.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: You’ll never believe what just happened, Ross just totally blew me off and he didn’t even tell me why!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh well. Y’know what honey? The best thing to do to get over a guy is to start dating someone else. Oh! There is this great guy you will love at work named Bob! He’s a real up-and-comer in Human Resources.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Y’know, thanks for trying to cheer me up, but I’m not gonna date some random guy from your work.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s not random, it’s Bob.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: It’s probably because not mature enough. Or smart enough. Maybe he doesn’t like the way I dress—No that can’t be it. It’s really gotta be the smart thing. Oh I’m so stupid! I’m just like this incredibly pretty stupid girl!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No honey, okay, okay, you wanna know why Ross canceled the date? Because I asked him to.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: You asked him too?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hm-mmm.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because you are my sister and Ross and I have this huge history…

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: I don’t understand, do you want to go out with Ross?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: You don’t want him, but you don’t want me to have him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know Bob in Human Resources…

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Ugh! I cannot believe you did this too me! You had me doubting how smart I was! (Gasps) You had me doubting my fashion sense!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look, this is not that big of a deal! You just don’t date Ross! There’s a million other guys out there, you just…

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Hey! You have no right to tell me what to do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not telling you what to do! I am telling you what not to do!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Why are you so jealous of me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Jill this is not about me being jealous of you! This is about you being a brat! Wanting what you can’t have!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Can’t have?! Excuse me, the only thing I can’t have is dairy ! (Starts to storm out.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, all right, well you just blew your chances at dating Bob!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Who?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: In Human Resources !!!!!!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Rachel is ranting about Jill to Chandler and Monica.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …I am jealous of her?! I mean who does she think she is?! Princess Caroline?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re jealous of Princess Caroline?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do I have my own castle?
(Joey and Ross enter.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Uh, Phoebe’s not here is she?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh great! Did you get a movie?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhhh, yeah. Yeah. But uh, I don’t think it’s the kind you’re gonna like.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You didn’t get more movies that are gonna have us reaching for the tissues all night did you?
(Joey and Ross exchange looks.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sort of…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Guys, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebe’s a porn star!

content.speaker: All
content.text: What?!!
(They all run over to Joey and Ross, Chandler grabs the movie and reads the title.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebe Buffay in Buffay: The Vampire Layer.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s Phoebe! Where did you get that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well down at the adult video place down on Bleaker.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And-and I, and I saw that Joey was about to go in, so I ran in ahead of him to-to surprise him and, and then I pretended I didn’t know he was in there. (They all kinda look at him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! I mean, I just—I can’t, I can’t believe this. Y’know, I mean you think you know someone even, even Phoebe who’s always been somewhat of a question mark.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is so bizarre. I guess it kinda makes sense though, y’know she had such a terrible childhood.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, I had a terrible childhood and I don’t do porn.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, but you are dead inside.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right well, I’d better take that back.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wh-what, why?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We can’t watch that! I mean that’s Phoebe!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah you’re right, we can’t—we shouldn’t watch this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Absolutely not.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know maybe a little bit!
content.parenthetical: hands the tape back to Joey, but doesn’t let him grab it

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Probably just the first half.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! Hey no! This is wrong you guys! Phoebe’s our friend! Well, I’m not gonna watch it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! Good for you Joe!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.
(Ross stands next to him for a second, then goes and watches the movie.)
(The movie starts, it’s a vampire’s lair and Buffay, The Vampire Layer enters dressed in leather and carrying a wooden stake. Suddenly, the vampire opens his coffin and sits up.

content.speaker: Buffay, the Vampire Layer
content.text: Ah, I thought I’d find you here, Nasforatool.

content.speaker: The Vampire
content.text: Buffay, are you going to plunge your stake into my dark places?

content.speaker: Buffay, the Vampire Layer
content.text: Actually, I was kinda hoping it would be the other way around.
(At this point, Buffay, the Vampire Layer and Nasforatool start to get it on. Of course, since this is network TV, we can only see the reactions of the gang to the film playing off screen.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hold on a second! What is that on her ankle?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Her ankle is what you’re watching?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well it’s hard to tell… (Rachel gets up to get a closer look, only she’s having some trouble.) Oh God, if she would just stop moving.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s just doing her job!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You sick bastards!
content.parenthetical: sitting at the kitchen table with his back to the TV

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s a tattoo! That’s weird, Phoebe doesn’t… Wait that’s Ursula! That’s not Phoebe that is Ursula!
(Upon hearing this, Joey can’t turn his chair around fast enough and knocks it over.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Re! Re! Then I can watch that! Rewind it! Rewind it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! What’s up? (Sees the TV) Oh my God! What am I doing?!!

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is reading Chicken Soup for the Soul as Monica enters.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey sweetie!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! (He quickly tries to hide the book by throwing it under the couch, only the couch has no back and it slides into the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chicken Soup for the Soul ?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There’s no back to this couch!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why are you reading this? You hate this kind of stuff.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah I know, but I figured a shot y’know? Maybe one of those stories would make me cry and then you wouldn’t think I was y’know, all dead inside.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that’s so sweet! Look Chandler I don’t care if you can’t cry, I love you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that makes me feel so warm in my hollow tin chest.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Stop it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I mean, come on, seriously think about it, we get married, we’re up at the altar and I’m like this. (Makes a bored face.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I won’t care, because I know you will be feeling it all in here. (Points to her heart.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! And if, and if we have a baby one-day, and the doctor hands it to you in the delivery room and you don’t cry, so what! And-and-and, and if we take him to college and come home and see his empty room for the first time, and you got nothing, it won’t matter to me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, well I won’t uh, worry about this anymore then.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And-and-and if I die, from a long illness. And you’re writing out my eulogy and you open a desk drawer and you find a note from me that says, “I will always be with you,” and you still can’t shed one tiny tear, I know you’ll be crying a river inside.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Aww, I love you so…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is wrong with you?!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! You can’t shed a tear for your dead wife!! Now, I left you a note from the beyond!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you didn’t mean any of that?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No you robot!!

content.description: Ross’s apartment, his doorbell is ringing and he’s running to answer it while doing up his pants.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You damn kids! You ring my bell one more time, I swear to… (Opens the door to find Jill standing there.) Ohh, uh Jill. Umm, that-that’s just a little game I play with the kids down the hall. Umm, they’ve really taken a liking to me. (Quickly looks out to see if they’re watching.) Uhh what’s-what’s-what’s the matter?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Rachel and I had a really big fight, can I come in? I-I mean I know we’re not supposed to see each other anymore and I’m okay with that, it’s just that I don’t know anybody in the city and I really need somebody to talk to about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course, what happened? (Lets her in.)

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: I don’t want to talk about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, umm…

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: But you know what might really cheer me up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Seeing some more of your super-cool slides.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! Really?!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Totally, I love them! And, maybe you could finish telling me about all the different kinds of sand.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’d love to! Here, you wait right here and I’ll go get the projector and my notes!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Oh great! Thanks Ross, you’re such a good friend!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh!
(He goes into another room to get his projector and notes. While he’s gone, Jill quickly checks her makeup.
[Cut to Monica and Chandler’s, Rachel is entering.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Have you guys seen Jill? I can’t find her anywhere.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I haven’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, is Ross home? Maybe I’ll just call him to see if he’s actually seen her.
(She goes to look out the window at Ross’s apartment and sees Jill staring at her and closing the drapes with an evil look on her face. Rachel is stunned into silence.)

content.description: Ursula’s apartment, Phoebe is going to confront her twin about her new porn career.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Who is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s Phoebe! Phoebe!
(Ursula opens the door and is all dressed up with big hair and lingerie.)

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh God. So-so you’re making porn movies.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: No I’m not.
(Someone calls out from her apartment.)

content.speaker: Man’s Voice
content.text: We’re still rolling!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re making one right now!

content.speaker: Another Man’s Voice
content.text: Let’s go Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And- and you’re using my name!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah, can I help you with something?

content.speaker: Same Man’s Voice
content.text: Phoebe, come on!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look, I’m talking right now! You’re—you mean her.

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Y’know, twin stuff is always a real big seller.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ursula
content.text: Yeah, I can talk them into giving you like, 30 dollars.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No!! No way! No! And stop using my name! And shame on you! (Yells into the apartment) And shame on all of you! You’re disgusting! Especially you (points to someone) with that! (Storms away.)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Ross is setting up for the slide show.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Slides are almost ready.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Yeah. Ooh, I know what this is missing! Alcohol!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh okay, well there’s-there’s wine in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Oh great! (Goes to get it as the phone rings.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What is my sister doing there?! And why are the drapes shut?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: O-okay, Rach calm-calm down, okay? She-she’s really upset we’re just talking.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross! I think she is trying to make something happen with you to get back at me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So that’s the only reason she could be here huh? It couldn’t have anything to do with the fact that-that maybe I’m a good listener and I uh I put on a great slide show!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, I am telling you that she is using you to get back at me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? I think I can take care of myself, I’ll talk to you later. Good-bye. (Hangs up the phone and turns to find Jill sitting really close to him.) Whoa! Uh, that was your sister actually. She-she thinks that you’re just using me.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: So? (Kisses him passionately.)

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is reading a paper as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, I just came from the company Ursula works for.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no, not you too!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! No! I just went to pick up Phoebe Buffay’s checks; there were a lot of them.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nice!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um-mmm, and I won’t have to go there anymore because I gave them my correct address.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s great, but isn’t it gonna bother that people still think you’re a porn star?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no! No! I know how to handle it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. (She notices some guy putting a coat on his girlfriend is trying to remember where he’s seen her before.) (To him) You’re trying to figure out where you know me from? All right, I’ll give you a hint. From porn! Okay? (He tries to rush his girlfriend out.) Yeah your pervert boyfriend watched me in a porno movie! (To Joey) See?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, time lapse, Ross is entering. Chandler and Monica are at the kitchen table. Rachel is on the couch reading.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You uh, you may have been right about Jill.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! I knew it! What happened?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, she kissed me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! You kissed!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe we should give them some privacy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shhhh!!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I uh, I tried not to kiss her, okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, it doesn’t sound like it! I mean, it’s pretty easy not to kiss someone, you just don’t kiss them! See look at us, right now, not kissing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let me finish, okay? She started kissing me and-and I didn’t stop it. I guess I-I just wasn’t thinking…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah that’s right you weren’t thinking! Y’know what? Let me give you something to think about! (She pulls up her sleeves and steps towards him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh wait—hold it! But then I started thinking and I stopped the kissing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well thank you for taking your tongue out of my sister’s mouth long enough to tell me that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look I-I realize if anything were to happen with me and Jill then nothing could ever happen with us!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I mean, look I don’t know if anything is going to happen with us, again. Ever. But I don’t want to know that it-it never could. So I stopped it and she got mad and broke my projector.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow. I, I don’t even know what to say. Thank you. (Gently kicks him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re welcome. (Gently kicks her back.)
(Chandler starts crying.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! Are-are you crying?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I just don’t see why those two can’t work things out!

content.description: Central Perk, everyone is there as Jill enters.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: All right, I’m leaving! Because I’m not going to spend one more day with someone whose out to sabotage my every move. That’s you Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I got that.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: And you! I throw myself at you and you say no, how gay are you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You take care Jill.

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Okay, see ya! (Exits.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye-bye-e!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I-I can’t believe Jill’s gone. (They all look at him.) I can’t help it, I opened a gate.
